metadata.name: App Service Landing Zone Accelerator
metadata.description: This Azure App Service pattern module represents an Azure App Service deployment aligned with the cloud adoption framework
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if both logs & metrics are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. suffix (max 10 characters long) that will be used to name the resources in a pattern like <resourceAbbreviation>-<workloadName>.
Optional. Azure region where the resources will be deployed in.
Optional. The name of the environmentName (e.g. "dev", "test", "prod", "preprod", "staging", "uat", "dr", "qa"). Up to 8 characters long.
Optional. Default is false. Set to true if you want to deploy ASE v3 instead of Multitenant App Service Plan.
Optional. CIDR of the SPOKE vnet i.e. 192.168.0.0/24.
Optional. CIDR of the subnet that will hold the app services plan. ATTENTION: ASEv3 needs a /24 network.
Optional. CIDR of the subnet that will hold the jumpbox.
Optional. CIDR of the subnet that will hold the private endpoints of the supporting services.
Optional. Default is empty. If given, peering between spoke and and existing hub vnet will be created.
Optional. Internal IP of the Azure firewall deployed in Hub. Used for creating UDR to route all vnet egress traffic through Firewall. If empty no UDR.
Optional. The size of the jump box virtual machine to create. See https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/sizes for more information.
Optional. Defines the name, tier, size, family and capacity of the App Service Plan. EP* is only for functions.
Optional. Set to true if you want to deploy the App Service Plan in a zone redundant manner. Default is true.
Optional. Kind of server OS of the App Service Plan. Default is "windows".
Conditional. Required if jumpbox deployed. The username of the admin user of the jumpbox VM.
Conditional. Required if jumpbox deployed and not using SSH key. The password of the admin user of the jumpbox VM.
Optional. Set to true if you want to intercept all outbound traffic with azure firewall.
Optional. Set to true if you want to deploy a jumpbox/devops VM.
Optional. Type of authentication to use on the Virtual Machine. SSH key is recommended. Default is "password".

Optional. The resource ID of the bastion host. If set, the spoke virtual network will be peered with the hub virtual network and the bastion host will be allowed to connect to the jump box. Default is empty.
Optional. Tags to apply to all resources.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Set to true if you want to auto-approve the private endpoint connection to the Azure Front Door.
Optional. Default is windows. The OS of the jump box virtual machine to create.
Optional. Diagnostic Settings for the App Service Plan.
Optional. Diagnostic Settings for the App Service Plan.
Optional. Diagnostic Settings for the ASE.
Optional. Diagnostic Settings for Front Door.
Optional. Diagnostic Settings for the KeyVault.

metadata.name: Resource Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Resource Group.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The name of the Resource Group.
Optional. Location of the Resource Group. It uses the deployment's location when not provided.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the storage account resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Required. The name of the Resource Group.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Azure Naming module
metadata.description: Module to maintain a consistent naming of Azure resources.
Optional. It is not recommended that you use prefix by azure you should be using a suffix for your resources.
Optional. It is recommended that you specify a suffix for consistency. Please use only lowercase characters when possible.
Optional. Custom seed value for the unique string to be created -defaults to resourceGroup Id.
Optional. Max length of the uniqueness suffix to be added -defaults to 4
Optional. Use dashes as separator where applicable -defaults to true
Optional. Create names using lowercase letters -defaults to true
Optional. Used when region abbreviation is needed (placeholder value is "**location**)

metadata.description: Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if both logs & metrics are supported by the resource provider.

metadata.name: Virtual Networks
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network (vNet).
Optional. The Name of VNET Peering resource. If not provided, default value will be peer-localVnetName-remoteVnetName.
Required. The Resource ID of the VNet that is this Local VNet is being peered to. Should be in the format of a Resource ID.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. Do not verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
Optional. Deploy the outbound and the inbound peering.
Optional. The name of the VNET Peering resource in the remove Virtual Network. If not provided, default value will be peer-remoteVnetName-localVnetName.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
Required. The Name of the subnet resource.
Conditional. The address prefix for the subnet. Required if `addressPrefixes` is empty.
Conditional. List of address prefixes for the subnet. Required if `addressPrefix` is empty.
Optional. Application gateway IP configurations of virtual network resource.
Optional. The delegation to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the NAT Gateway to use for the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the network security group to assign to the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private endpoint in the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private link service in the subnet.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. The resource ID of the route table to assign to the subnet.
Optional. An array of service endpoint policies.
Optional. The service endpoints to enable on the subnet.

Optional. Set this property to false to disable default outbound connectivity for all VMs in the subnet. This property can only be set at the time of subnet creation and cannot be updated for an existing subnet.

Optional. Set this property to Tenant to allow sharing subnet with other subscriptions in your AAD tenant. This property can only be set if defaultOutboundAccess is set to false, both properties can only be set if subnet is empty.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if both logs & metrics are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The name of the Virtual Network (vNet).
Optional. Location for all resources.
Required. An Array of 1 or more IP Address Prefixes for the Virtual Network.
Optional. The BGP community associated with the virtual network.
Optional. An Array of subnets to deploy to the Virtual Network.
Optional. DNS Servers associated to the Virtual Network.

Optional. Resource ID of the DDoS protection plan to assign the VNET to. If it's left blank, DDoS protection will not be configured. If it's provided, the VNET created by this template will be attached to the referenced DDoS protection plan. The DDoS protection plan can exist in the same or in a different subscription.
Optional. Virtual Network Peering configurations.

Optional. Indicates if encryption is enabled on virtual network and if VM without encryption is allowed in encrypted VNet. Requires the EnableVNetEncryption feature to be registered for the subscription and a supported region to use this property.
Optional. If the encrypted VNet allows VM that does not support encryption. Can only be used when vnetEncryption is enabled.

Optional. The flow timeout in minutes for the Virtual Network, which is used to enable connection tracking for intra-VM flows. Possible values are between 4 and 30 minutes. Default value 0 will set the property to null.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Indicates if VM protection is enabled for all the subnets in the virtual network.

Conditional. The name of the parent user assigned identity. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the secret.

Required. The list of audiences that can appear in the issued token. Should be set to api://AzureADTokenExchange for Azure AD. It says what Microsoft identity platform should accept in the aud claim in the incoming token. This value represents Azure AD in your external identity provider and has no fixed value across identity providers - you might need to create a new application registration in your IdP to serve as the audience of this token.
Required. The URL of the issuer to be trusted. Must match the issuer claim of the external token being exchanged.

Required. The identifier of the external software workload within the external identity provider. Like the audience value, it has no fixed format, as each IdP uses their own - sometimes a GUID, sometimes a colon delimited identifier, sometimes arbitrary strings. The value here must match the sub claim within the token presented to Azure AD.

properties.scriptContent: rg_name="$ResourceGroupName"; webapp_ids=$(az webapp list -g $rg_name --query "[].id" -o tsv); for webapp_id in $webapp_ids; do fd_conn_ids=$(az network private-endpoint-connection list --id $webapp_id --query "[?properties.provisioningState == 'Pending'].id" -o tsv); for fd_conn_id in $fd_conn_ids; do az network private-endpoint-connection approve --id "$fd_conn_id" --description "ApprovedByCli"; done; done

variables.$fxv#0:
<#
.SYNOPSIS
Generate a new Public SSH Key or fetch it from an existing Public SSH Key resource.

.DESCRIPTION
Generate a new Public SSH Key or fetch it from an existing Public SSH Key resource.

.PARAMETER SSHKeyName
Mandatory. The name of the Public SSH Key Resource as it would be deployed in Azure

.PARAMETER ResourceGroupName
Mandatory. The resource group name of the Public SSH Key Resource as it would be deployed in Azure

.EXAMPLE
./New-SSHKey.ps1 -SSHKeyName 'myKeyResource' -ResourceGroupName 'ssh-rg'

Generate a new Public SSH Key or fetch it from an existing Public SSH Key resource 'myKeyResource' in Resource Group 'ssh-rg'
#>
param(
    [Parameter(Mandatory = $true)]
    [string] $SSHKeyName,

    [Parameter(Mandatory = $true)]
    [string] $ResourceGroupName
)

if (-not ($sshKey = Get-AzSshKey -ResourceGroupName $ResourceGroupName | Where-Object { $_.Name -eq $SSHKeyName })) {
    Write-Verbose "No SSH key [$SSHKeyName] found in Resource Group [$ResourceGroupName]. Generating new." -Verbose
    $null = ssh-keygen -f generated -N (Get-Random -Maximum 99999)
    $publicKey = Get-Content 'generated.pub' -Raw
    # $privateKey = cat generated | Out-String
} else {
    Write-Verbose "SSH key [$SSHKeyName] found in Resource Group [$ResourceGroupName]. Returning." -Verbose
    $publicKey = $sshKey.publicKey
}
# Write into Deployment Script output stream
$DeploymentScriptOutputs = @{
    # Requires conversion as the script otherwise returns an object instead of the plain public key string
    publicKey = $publicKey | Out-String
}

metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Machine with one or multiple NICs and optionally one or multiple public IPs.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The disk name.
Optional. Specifies the size of an empty data disk in gigabytes.
Optional. Specifies how the virtual machine should be created.
Optional. Specifies whether data disk should be deleted or detached upon VM deletion.
Optional. Specifies the caching requirements.
Optional. Specifies the storage account type for the managed disk.
Optional. Specifies the customer managed disk encryption set resource id for the managed disk.
Required. The managed disk parameters.
Optional. The disk name.
Optional. Specifies the logical unit number of the data disk.
Required. Specifies the size of an empty data disk in gigabytes.
Optional. Specifies how the virtual machine should be created.
Optional. Specifies whether data disk should be deleted or detached upon VM deletion.
Optional. Specifies the caching requirements.
Optional. The number of IOPS allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. One operation can transfer between 4k and 256k bytes.
Optional. The bandwidth allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. MBps means millions of bytes per second - MB here uses the ISO notation, of powers of 10.
Required. Specifies the storage account type for the managed disk.
Optional. Specifies the customer managed disk encryption set resource id for the managed disk.
Optional. Specifies the customer managed disk id for the managed disk.
Required. The managed disk parameters.
Required. The name of the virtual machine to be created. You should use a unique prefix to reduce name collisions in Active Directory.
Optional. Can be used if the computer name needs to be different from the Azure VM resource name. If not used, the resource name will be used as computer name.
Required. Specifies the size for the VMs.

Optional. This property can be used by user in the request to enable or disable the Host Encryption for the virtual machine. This will enable the encryption for all the disks including Resource/Temp disk at host itself. For security reasons, it is recommended to set encryptionAtHost to True. Restrictions: Cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your VMs.

Optional. Specifies the SecurityType of the virtual machine. It has to be set to any specified value to enable UefiSettings. The default behavior is: UefiSettings will not be enabled unless this property is set.
Optional. Specifies whether secure boot should be enabled on the virtual machine. This parameter is part of the UefiSettings. SecurityType should be set to TrustedLaunch to enable UefiSettings.
Optional. Specifies whether vTPM should be enabled on the virtual machine. This parameter is part of the UefiSettings.  SecurityType should be set to TrustedLaunch to enable UefiSettings.
Required. OS image reference. In case of marketplace images, it's the combination of the publisher, offer, sku, version attributes. In case of custom images it's the resource ID of the custom image.

Optional. Specifies information about the marketplace image used to create the virtual machine. This element is only used for marketplace images. Before you can use a marketplace image from an API, you must enable the image for programmatic use.

Required. Specifies the OS disk. For security reasons, it is recommended to specify DiskEncryptionSet into the osDisk object.  Restrictions: DiskEncryptionSet cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your VMs.

Optional. Specifies the data disks. For security reasons, it is recommended to specify DiskEncryptionSet into the dataDisk object. Restrictions: DiskEncryptionSet cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your VMs.

Optional. The flag that enables or disables a capability to have one or more managed data disks with UltraSSD_LRS storage account type on the VM or VMSS. Managed disks with storage account type UltraSSD_LRS can be added to a virtual machine or virtual machine scale set only if this property is enabled.
Required. Administrator username.
Optional. When specifying a Windows Virtual Machine, this value should be passed.
Optional. UserData for the VM, which must be base-64 encoded. Customer should not pass any secrets in here.
Optional. Custom data associated to the VM, this value will be automatically converted into base64 to account for the expected VM format.
Optional. Specifies set of certificates that should be installed onto the virtual machine.
Optional. Specifies the priority for the virtual machine.
Optional. Specifies the eviction policy for the low priority virtual machine. Will result in 'Deallocate' eviction policy.
Optional. Specifies the maximum price you are willing to pay for a low priority VM/VMSS. This price is in US Dollars.
Optional. Specifies resource ID about the dedicated host that the virtual machine resides in.
Optional. Specifies that the image or disk that is being used was licensed on-premises.
Optional. The list of SSH public keys used to authenticate with linux based VMs.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource. The system-assigned managed identity will automatically be enabled if extensionAadJoinConfig.enabled = "True".

Optional. Whether boot diagnostics should be enabled on the Virtual Machine. Boot diagnostics will be enabled with a managed storage account if no bootDiagnosticsStorageAccountName value is provided. If bootDiagnostics and bootDiagnosticsStorageAccountName values are not provided, boot diagnostics will be disabled.
Optional. Custom storage account used to store boot diagnostic information. Boot diagnostics will be enabled with a custom storage account if a value is provided.
Optional. Storage account boot diagnostic base URI.
Optional. Resource ID of a proximity placement group.
Optional. Resource ID of a virtual machine scale set, where the VM should be added.
Optional. Resource ID of an availability set. Cannot be used in combination with availability zone nor scale set.
Optional. Specifies the gallery applications that should be made available to the VM/VMSS.

Required. If set to 1, 2 or 3, the availability zone for all VMs is hardcoded to that value. If zero, then availability zones is not used. Cannot be used in combination with availability set nor scale set.
Required. Configures NICs and PIPs.
Optional. Recovery service vault name to add VMs to backup.
Optional. Resource group of the backup recovery service vault. If not provided the current resource group name is considered by default.
Optional. Backup policy the VMs should be using for backup. If not provided, it will use the DefaultPolicy from the backup recovery service vault.
Optional. The configuration for auto-shutdown.
Optional. The resource Id of a maintenance configuration for this VM.
Optional. Specifies whether extension operations should be allowed on the virtual machine. This may only be set to False when no extensions are present on the virtual machine.
Optional. Required if name is specified. Password of the user specified in user parameter.
Optional. The configuration for the [Domain Join] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.

Optional. The configuration for the [AAD Join] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed. To enroll in Intune, add the setting mdmId: "0000000a-0000-0000-c000-000000000000".
Optional. The configuration for the [Anti Malware] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Monitoring Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Dependency Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Network Watcher Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.

Optional. The configuration for the [Azure Disk Encryption] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed. Restrictions: Cannot be enabled on disks that have encryption at host enabled. Managed disks encrypted using Azure Disk Encryption cannot be encrypted using customer-managed keys.
Optional. The configuration for the [Desired State Configuration] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Custom Script] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Nvidia Gpu Driver Windows] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Host Pool Registration] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed. Needs a managed identy.
Optional. The configuration for the [Guest Configuration] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed. Needs a managed identy.
Optional. The guest configuration for the virtual machine. Needs the Guest Configuration extension to be enabled.
Optional. An object that contains the extension specific protected settings.
Optional. An object that contains the extension specific protected settings.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Generated. Do not provide a value! This date value is used to generate a registration token.

Optional. SAS token validity length to use to download files from storage accounts. Usage: 'PT8H' - valid for 8 hours; 'P5D' - valid for 5 days; 'P1Y' - valid for 1 year. When not provided, the SAS token will be valid for 8 hours.
Required. The chosen OS type.
Optional. Specifies whether password authentication should be disabled.

Optional. Indicates whether virtual machine agent should be provisioned on the virtual machine. When this property is not specified in the request body, default behavior is to set it to true. This will ensure that VM Agent is installed on the VM so that extensions can be added to the VM later.

Optional. Indicates whether Automatic Updates is enabled for the Windows virtual machine. Default value is true. When patchMode is set to Manual, this parameter must be set to false. For virtual machine scale sets, this property can be updated and updates will take effect on OS reprovisioning.

Optional. VM guest patching orchestration mode. 'AutomaticByOS' & 'Manual' are for Windows only, 'ImageDefault' for Linux only. Refer to 'https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/automatic-vm-guest-patching'.
Optional. Enables customer to schedule patching without accidental upgrades.
Optional. Specifies the reboot setting for all AutomaticByPlatform patch installation operations.
Optional. VM guest patching assessment mode. Set it to 'AutomaticByPlatform' to enable automatically check for updates every 24 hours.

Optional. Enables customers to patch their Azure VMs without requiring a reboot. For enableHotpatching, the 'provisionVMAgent' must be set to true and 'patchMode' must be set to 'AutomaticByPlatform'.
Optional. Specifies the time zone of the virtual machine. e.g. 'Pacific Standard Time'. Possible values can be `TimeZoneInfo.id` value from time zones returned by `TimeZoneInfo.GetSystemTimeZones`.

Optional. Specifies additional XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup. Contents are defined by setting name, component name, and the pass in which the content is applied.
Optional. Specifies the Windows Remote Management listeners. This enables remote Windows PowerShell. - WinRMConfiguration object.

Optional. The configuration profile of automanage. Either '/providers/Microsoft.Automanage/bestPractices/AzureBestPracticesProduction', 'providers/Microsoft.Automanage/bestPractices/AzureBestPracticesDevTest' or the resource Id of custom profile.

Required. The domain name label. The concatenation of the domain name label and the regionalized DNS zone make up the fully qualified domain name associated with the public IP address. If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.

Required. The domain name label scope. If a domain name label and a domain name label scope are specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system with a hashed value includes in FQDN.
Optional. The Fully Qualified Domain Name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone.

Optional. The reverse FQDN. A user-visible, fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.
Required. The resource ID of the DDOS protection plan associated with the public IP address.
Optional. The DDoS protection plan associated with the public IP address.
Required. The DDoS protection policy customizations.

Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.

metadata.name: Virtual Machine Extensions
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Machine Extension.
Conditional. The name of the parent virtual machine that extension is provisioned for. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the virtual machine extension.
Optional. The location the extension is deployed to.
Required. The name of the extension handler publisher.
Required. Specifies the type of the extension; an example is "CustomScriptExtension".
Required. Specifies the version of the script handler.

Optional. How the extension handler should be forced to update even if the extension configuration has not changed.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific settings.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific protected settings.

metadata.name: Network Security Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Network security Group (NSG).
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. The name of the security rule.
Required. Whether network traffic is allowed or denied.
Optional. The description of the security rule.

Optional. Optional. The destination address prefix. CIDR or destination IP range. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as "VirtualNetwork", "AzureLoadBalancer" and "Internet" can also be used.
Optional. The destination address prefixes. CIDR or destination IP ranges.
Optional. The resource IDs of the application security groups specified as destination.
Optional. The destination port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all ports.
Optional. The destination port ranges.
Required. The direction of the rule. The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic.

Required. Required. The priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.
Required. Network protocol this rule applies to.

Optional. The CIDR or source IP range. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as "VirtualNetwork", "AzureLoadBalancer" and "Internet" can also be used. If this is an ingress rule, specifies where network traffic originates from.
Optional. The CIDR or source IP ranges.
Optional. The resource IDs of the application security groups specified as source.
Optional. The source port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all ports.
Optional. The source port ranges.
Required. The properties of the security rule.
Required. Name of the Network Security Group.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Array of Security Rules to deploy to the Network Security Group. When not provided, an NSG including only the built-in roles will be deployed.

Optional. When enabled, flows created from Network Security Group connections will be re-evaluated when rules are updates. Initial enablement will trigger re-evaluation. Network Security Group connection flushing is not available in all regions.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the NSG resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: The resource group the network security group was deployed into.
The resource ID of the network security group.
The name of the network security group.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Virtual Network Subnets
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network Subnet.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The Name of the subnet resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent virtual network. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The address prefix for the subnet. Required if `addressPrefixes` is empty.
Optional. The resource ID of the network security group to assign to the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the route table to assign to the subnet.
Optional. The service endpoints to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The delegation to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the NAT Gateway to use for the subnet.
Optional. Enable or disable apply network policies on private endpoint in the subnet.
Optional. Enable or disable apply network policies on private link service in the subnet.
Conditional. List of address prefixes for the subnet. Required if `addressPrefix` is empty.

Optional. Set this property to false to disable default outbound connectivity for all VMs in the subnet. This property can only be set at the time of subnet creation and cannot be updated for an existing subnet.

Optional. Set this property to Tenant to allow sharing the subnet with other subscriptions in your AAD tenant. This property can only be set if defaultOutboundAccess is set to false, both properties can only be set if the subnet is empty.
Optional. Application gateway IP configurations of virtual network resource.
Optional. An array of service endpoint policies.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.
The address prefix for the subnet.
List of address prefixes for the subnet.

metadata.name: Virtual Machines
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Machine with one or multiple NICs and optionally one or multiple public IPs.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The disk name.
Optional. Specifies the size of an empty data disk in gigabytes.
Optional. Specifies how the virtual machine should be created.
Optional. Specifies whether data disk should be deleted or detached upon VM deletion.
Optional. Specifies the caching requirements.
Optional. Specifies the storage account type for the managed disk.
Optional. Specifies the customer managed disk encryption set resource id for the managed disk.
Required. The managed disk parameters.
Optional. The disk name.
Optional. Specifies the logical unit number of the data disk.
Required. Specifies the size of an empty data disk in gigabytes.
Optional. Specifies how the virtual machine should be created.
Optional. Specifies whether data disk should be deleted or detached upon VM deletion.
Optional. Specifies the caching requirements.
Optional. The number of IOPS allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. One operation can transfer between 4k and 256k bytes.
Optional. The bandwidth allowed for this disk; only settable for UltraSSD disks. MBps means millions of bytes per second - MB here uses the ISO notation, of powers of 10.
Required. Specifies the storage account type for the managed disk.
Optional. Specifies the customer managed disk encryption set resource id for the managed disk.
Optional. Specifies the customer managed disk id for the managed disk.
Required. The managed disk parameters.
Required. The name of the virtual machine to be created. You should use a unique prefix to reduce name collisions in Active Directory.
Optional. Can be used if the computer name needs to be different from the Azure VM resource name. If not used, the resource name will be used as computer name.
Required. Specifies the size for the VMs.

Optional. This property can be used by user in the request to enable or disable the Host Encryption for the virtual machine. This will enable the encryption for all the disks including Resource/Temp disk at host itself. For security reasons, it is recommended to set encryptionAtHost to True. Restrictions: Cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your VMs.

Optional. Specifies the SecurityType of the virtual machine. It has to be set to any specified value to enable UefiSettings. The default behavior is: UefiSettings will not be enabled unless this property is set.
Optional. Specifies whether secure boot should be enabled on the virtual machine. This parameter is part of the UefiSettings. SecurityType should be set to TrustedLaunch to enable UefiSettings.
Optional. Specifies whether vTPM should be enabled on the virtual machine. This parameter is part of the UefiSettings.  SecurityType should be set to TrustedLaunch to enable UefiSettings.
Required. OS image reference. In case of marketplace images, it's the combination of the publisher, offer, sku, version attributes. In case of custom images it's the resource ID of the custom image.

Optional. Specifies information about the marketplace image used to create the virtual machine. This element is only used for marketplace images. Before you can use a marketplace image from an API, you must enable the image for programmatic use.

Required. Specifies the OS disk. For security reasons, it is recommended to specify DiskEncryptionSet into the osDisk object.  Restrictions: DiskEncryptionSet cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your VMs.

Optional. Specifies the data disks. For security reasons, it is recommended to specify DiskEncryptionSet into the dataDisk object. Restrictions: DiskEncryptionSet cannot be enabled if Azure Disk Encryption (guest-VM encryption using bitlocker/DM-Crypt) is enabled on your VMs.

Optional. The flag that enables or disables a capability to have one or more managed data disks with UltraSSD_LRS storage account type on the VM or VMSS. Managed disks with storage account type UltraSSD_LRS can be added to a virtual machine or virtual machine scale set only if this property is enabled.
Required. Administrator username.
Optional. When specifying a Windows Virtual Machine, this value should be passed.
Optional. UserData for the VM, which must be base-64 encoded. Customer should not pass any secrets in here.
Optional. Custom data associated to the VM, this value will be automatically converted into base64 to account for the expected VM format.
Optional. Specifies set of certificates that should be installed onto the virtual machine.
Optional. Specifies the priority for the virtual machine.
Optional. Specifies the eviction policy for the low priority virtual machine. Will result in 'Deallocate' eviction policy.
Optional. Specifies the maximum price you are willing to pay for a low priority VM/VMSS. This price is in US Dollars.
Optional. Specifies resource ID about the dedicated host that the virtual machine resides in.
Optional. Specifies that the image or disk that is being used was licensed on-premises.
Optional. The list of SSH public keys used to authenticate with linux based VMs.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource. The system-assigned managed identity will automatically be enabled if extensionAadJoinConfig.enabled = "True".

Optional. Whether boot diagnostics should be enabled on the Virtual Machine. Boot diagnostics will be enabled with a managed storage account if no bootDiagnosticsStorageAccountName value is provided. If bootDiagnostics and bootDiagnosticsStorageAccountName values are not provided, boot diagnostics will be disabled.
Optional. Custom storage account used to store boot diagnostic information. Boot diagnostics will be enabled with a custom storage account if a value is provided.
Optional. Storage account boot diagnostic base URI.
Optional. Resource ID of a proximity placement group.
Optional. Resource ID of a virtual machine scale set, where the VM should be added.
Optional. Resource ID of an availability set. Cannot be used in combination with availability zone nor scale set.
Optional. Specifies the gallery applications that should be made available to the VM/VMSS.

Required. If set to 1, 2 or 3, the availability zone for all VMs is hardcoded to that value. If zero, then availability zones is not used. Cannot be used in combination with availability set nor scale set.
Required. Configures NICs and PIPs.
Optional. Recovery service vault name to add VMs to backup.
Optional. Resource group of the backup recovery service vault. If not provided the current resource group name is considered by default.
Optional. Backup policy the VMs should be using for backup. If not provided, it will use the DefaultPolicy from the backup recovery service vault.
Optional. The configuration for auto-shutdown.
Optional. The resource Id of a maintenance configuration for this VM.
Optional. Specifies whether extension operations should be allowed on the virtual machine. This may only be set to False when no extensions are present on the virtual machine.
Optional. Required if name is specified. Password of the user specified in user parameter.
Optional. The configuration for the [Domain Join] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.

Optional. The configuration for the [AAD Join] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed. To enroll in Intune, add the setting mdmId: "0000000a-0000-0000-c000-000000000000".
Optional. The configuration for the [Anti Malware] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Monitoring Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Dependency Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Network Watcher Agent] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.

Optional. The configuration for the [Azure Disk Encryption] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed. Restrictions: Cannot be enabled on disks that have encryption at host enabled. Managed disks encrypted using Azure Disk Encryption cannot be encrypted using customer-managed keys.
Optional. The configuration for the [Desired State Configuration] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Custom Script] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Nvidia Gpu Driver Windows] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed.
Optional. The configuration for the [Host Pool Registration] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed. Needs a managed identy.
Optional. The configuration for the [Guest Configuration] extension. Must at least contain the ["enabled": true] property to be executed. Needs a managed identy.
Optional. The guest configuration for the virtual machine. Needs the Guest Configuration extension to be enabled.
Optional. An object that contains the extension specific protected settings.
Optional. An object that contains the extension specific protected settings.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Generated. Do not provide a value! This date value is used to generate a registration token.

Optional. SAS token validity length to use to download files from storage accounts. Usage: 'PT8H' - valid for 8 hours; 'P5D' - valid for 5 days; 'P1Y' - valid for 1 year. When not provided, the SAS token will be valid for 8 hours.
Required. The chosen OS type.
Optional. Specifies whether password authentication should be disabled.

Optional. Indicates whether virtual machine agent should be provisioned on the virtual machine. When this property is not specified in the request body, default behavior is to set it to true. This will ensure that VM Agent is installed on the VM so that extensions can be added to the VM later.

Optional. Indicates whether Automatic Updates is enabled for the Windows virtual machine. Default value is true. When patchMode is set to Manual, this parameter must be set to false. For virtual machine scale sets, this property can be updated and updates will take effect on OS reprovisioning.

Optional. VM guest patching orchestration mode. 'AutomaticByOS' & 'Manual' are for Windows only, 'ImageDefault' for Linux only. Refer to 'https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/automatic-vm-guest-patching'.
Optional. Enables customer to schedule patching without accidental upgrades.
Optional. Specifies the reboot setting for all AutomaticByPlatform patch installation operations.
Optional. VM guest patching assessment mode. Set it to 'AutomaticByPlatform' to enable automatically check for updates every 24 hours.

Optional. Enables customers to patch their Azure VMs without requiring a reboot. For enableHotpatching, the 'provisionVMAgent' must be set to true and 'patchMode' must be set to 'AutomaticByPlatform'.
Optional. Specifies the time zone of the virtual machine. e.g. 'Pacific Standard Time'. Possible values can be `TimeZoneInfo.id` value from time zones returned by `TimeZoneInfo.GetSystemTimeZones`.

Optional. Specifies additional XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup. Contents are defined by setting name, component name, and the pass in which the content is applied.
Optional. Specifies the Windows Remote Management listeners. This enables remote Windows PowerShell. - WinRMConfiguration object.

Optional. The configuration profile of automanage. Either '/providers/Microsoft.Automanage/bestPractices/AzureBestPracticesProduction', 'providers/Microsoft.Automanage/bestPractices/AzureBestPracticesDevTest' or the resource Id of custom profile.

Required. The domain name label. The concatenation of the domain name label and the regionalized DNS zone make up the fully qualified domain name associated with the public IP address. Optional. The reverse FQDN. A user-visible, fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.

Conditional. The name of the parent virtual machine that extension is provisioned for. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the virtual machine extension.
Optional. The location the extension is deployed to.
Required. The name of the extension handler publisher.
Required. Specifies the type of the extension; an example is "CustomScriptExtension".
Required. Specifies the version of the script handler.

Required. Indicates whether the extension should use a newer minor version if one is available at deployment time. Once deployed, however, the extension will not upgrade minor versions unless redeployed, even with this property set to true.
Optional. How the extension handler should be forced to update even if the extension configuration has not changed.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific settings.
Optional. Any object that contains the extension specific protected settings.

Optional. Indicates whether failures stemming from the extension will be suppressed (Operational failures such as not connecting to the VM will not be suppressed regardless of this value). The default is false.
Required. Indicates whether the extension should be automatically upgraded by the platform if there is a newer version of the extension available.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
The name of the extension.
The resource ID of the extension.
The name of the Resource Group the extension was created in.
The location the resource was deployed into.
